means: [女子名] 阿比盖尔来源于希伯来语，含义是“教父欣喜”(father rejoiced) 昵称Abby,Gail,Nabby

sentence.Network_en: Abigail's mother Linda views her daughter's talent with a mixture of pride and worry.
sentence.Network_cn: 阿比盖尔的母亲琳达带着一种又骄傲又担忧的复杂情绪看待女儿的才华。

sentence.Network_en: Are you cousin Rachel , the daughter of Benjamin and Abigail Wheeler?

sentence.Network_en: In that case, you must come along with Abigail and Jessica to Thanksgiving.
sentence.Network_cn: 如果是这样的话, 你必须同艾比盖尔和杰茜一起来过感恩节.

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 17th cent.: from the name of a character in The Scornful Lady by Beaumont and Fletcher, possibly in allusion to 1 Sam. 25: 23–24: ‘And when Abigail saw David, she … fell at his feet, and said, “… hear the words of thine handmaid”.’

encyclopedia.content: 阿比盖尔·布兰斯林，美国女演员，自小成名，是迄今为止奥斯卡历史上获得提名时年纪第四小的演员，在第79届奥斯卡上获得最佳女配角提名的她那时只有11岁。在其代表作《阳光小美女》中，扮演了希望赢得选美比赛的小女孩奥利弗，后又演了多部影片，受到观众的喜爱。

Sentence.sentence: But in single-sex schools teachers can tailor lessons to boys' learning style, letting them move around the classroom and getting them to compete in teams to prevent boredom, wrote the study's author, Abigail James, of the University of Virginia.
According to Abigail James, one of the advantages of single-sex schools is boys can choose to learn whatever they are interested in
Which of the following is characteristic of boys according to Abigail James' report?
